abstract: Evacuation of 125 United States Special Operations advisers from Yemen strikes yet another blow to counterterrorism campaign in the Middle East; evacuation has compromised Yemen as site for training, advising and intelligence gathering, even as Al Qaeda's local affiliate continues to pose major threat; Central Intelligence Agency will maintain some covert agents in country.
lead_paragraph: The evacuation of Special Operations advisers from Yemen is the latest blow to the Obama administration’s counterterrorism campaign, which is already struggling with significant setbacks in the region, officials said.

headline.main: Out of Yemen, U.S. Is Hobbled in Terror Fight
headline.print_headline: Out of Yemen, U.S. Is Hobbled in Terror Fight

snippet: The evacuation of Special Operations advisers from Yemen is the latest blow to the Obama administration’s counterterrorism campaign, which is already struggling with significant setbacks in the region, officials said.
